ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The atmospherein this class is not very active, not very like a communication class, but more like an acting class, or PRETENDING class.The teacher is very careful and thoughtful, but the homework in this class, I think, is not very helpful as lots of them are just FORM. Form is important, but students prefer to learn something DRY and SOLID, if they cannot learn in a fun way.
N/A

The readings for the class was very helpful as well as the instructor was very clear on what he was trying to convey. I liked the way he taught English to non-native speakers. The class has taught various skills of spoken and written English.
Wonder experience.
Great course for communication. Especially good for non-native.
Practicum
The teacher is very careful and thoughtful.
Good coomunication skills
The class designed to help international student improve their written and oral communication skills. Focused on the most important areas for international students.
that the course taught many fundamental things which one many not have chance to look at. E.g. how to frame ideas, what structure should be used to answer any question, presentation roadmap etc.

The best thing about this course was that you get to measure your progress in communication from the beginning of the course with the initial assessment to the end of the course with the final assessment.

The best thing about the class was the discussion sessions every Monday. It was when we could really work on the skills we learned the last week. I think the discussion sessions were longer and focused on those who needed more help.
Lot of inputs by the instructor
Give many useful skills and culture background, vey helpful to international students.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: The class definitely needs to be more active.
more practice opportunities
Pace of the course - there was too much information and material to be covered in a short period of time.
The writing skills could be taught in more detail.

The hours for the practicum were late during Monday, for this kind of activity a morning session suits better. Some students didn't take the practicum sessions seriously and that lessened the impact they could have had on the rest of the group.This course didn't have a TA and maybe it would be interesting to experiment and have a TA who holds individual practice sessions with each student to do oral assessment. I believe this would be more useful than going to a communication coach, since it would follow the course syllabus more than what the student wants to work on. This is not saying that the communication coaches aren't a good help, it is only in regard to practicing the course materials.
It should be more practical based with more time for discussion and practice of skills learned in the class.
More practicals
Involving some US students?

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: One on one training during practicum.
The instructor helps me with my pronunciation, which is very useful.
Usually received help for instructor quickly
Instructor - Yes. The professor was very dedicated and helpful.
Instructor was very approachable and helpful.
The help received by the instructor was always of quality and at any time when requested.
The professor was very helpful but sometime I felt that he was little biased towards good students. I feel that this class should focus more in students needing more help.
Instructor was always very cooperative in dealings
They are very responsible.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: Good and useful
The class will help me improve my communication skills and help me be more confident to participate in class discussions and group work.
The course has helped me gain better communication skills required to excel in any arena.
This kind of personal skills course really fits into the overall program because it prepares you to better communicate your ideas in an oral or written manner.
The course fits very well with my overall program because it has given me reading and analytical skills which is very necessary to do well in other courses.
Yes, very well

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: It is a mandatory course.
Required
I had to take the course because of my result on a placement test.
To improve my communication skills.
I took this course because my writing skills were not strong andI needed to better them.
I took this course because it was mandatory for me. But I don't regret taking this course. It has been very helpful.
Because it was made compulsory
To improve my communication skills.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes.
Yes
Yes, exceeded my expectations.
I would say 9 out of 10.
This course lived up to my expectations in the sense that it provided a solid refresher of language skills and a new set of communication abilities that help enhance the F&ES experience.
Yes, the class was good enough, it was just I could not give as much time it required. I didn't live up to my own expectations.
yes
Yes, though it's heavier than I expected.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes
Yes, even more - I benefited greatly from the class and believe I can use what I learned in my academic career.
I expected more emphasis on pronunciation.
I had no honest expectations of this course, I had no idea what to expect when I signed up for it. However what I got out of it was worth the effort.

As I mentioned above, the class was very good and very helpful. But I could not give in the time for all the assignments that was supposed to be done throughout the week and I didn't live up to my expectations on my own.
More then that
Yes, I think I got improved.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantage: help each other and correct each other.Disadvantage: No.
Advantages - communication with other international students.
Group work was done during practicum to practice some of the speaking skills.
The class did not have any group work or project but sometime we worked in groups in discussion sessions, which was helpful.
It is always required or to learn fast in such a course

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Great course for international students.
If you can digest everything that you learn, you will be able to communicate with people even better than native speakers.
practice more
Learn as much as possible and take the time to do all the assignments.
Be regular to coursework. Make sure that you continue to use the taught skills even after course ends.
Keep up the work, in the end the rewards are numerous.
If you really think that you need to improve your English take this class.

I advise to make it compulsory for all, may with some moderation. If not possible then it will be in the interest of the reputation of University like Yale that the office bearers of Clubs, Associations etc., who are organizing or interacting a lot ( almost daily) with the graduate folks through emails, meetings, letter writings, workshops, lectures etc should attend this course. It will facilitate in the improvement of culture and reputation of the University.
